intro: Cryptostemon, commonly known as the "Christmas star" or "star of Bethlehem," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and features small, fragrant white or pink flowers that bloom in winter. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to coastal and sandy soils. Cryptostemon is also valued for its ability to attract native pollinators.
